channel.title: Comments on: The Love Letter of O
channel.description: BDSM, books and missing links by Xiao Yingtai

item.title: By: Xiao Yingtai
item.dc:creator: Xiao Yingtai
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/the-love-letter-of-o/#comment-784">John</a>.
... You have a strong stomach! I guess I think it's harder to juxtapose beauty and horror than to just wallow in a cesspit. But to each their own!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to John.

… You have a strong stomach! I guess I think it’s harder to juxtapose beauty and horror than to just wallow in a cesspit. But to each their own!

item.title: By: John
item.dc:creator: John
item.description: I am very fond of Story of O but count 120 Days of Sodom as the best book I've ever read: it draws disgust not from your throat but from the pit of your stomach and for words to acheive that is truly something.
item.content:encoded: I am very fond of Story of O but count 120 Days of Sodom as the best book I’ve ever read: it draws disgust not from your throat but from the pit of your stomach and for words to acheive that is truly something.

item.title: By: Xiao Yingtai
item.dc:creator: Xiao Yingtai
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/the-love-letter-of-o/#comment-756">cdibbs</a>.
Thank <em>you!</em> I was actually kind of worried that I had written something which would only make sense to myself, so it's a relief to hear you enjoyed it.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to cdibbs.

Thank you! I was actually kind of worried that I had written something which would only make sense to myself, so it’s a relief to hear you enjoyed it.

item.title: By: Xiao Yingtai
item.dc:creator: Xiao Yingtai
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/the-love-letter-of-o/#comment-755">shinykicks (@shinykicks)</a>.
Thanks! I found it really interesting where she does and doesn't report O's feelings and reactions. And one of the group members said he's going to reread it looking for the religious language this time. I'm curious what you'll find!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to shinykicks (@shinykicks).

Thanks! I found it really interesting where she does and doesn’t report O’s feelings and reactions. And one of the group members said he’s going to reread it looking for the religious language this time. I’m curious what you’ll find!

item.title: By: cdibbs
item.dc:creator: cdibbs
item.description: This is a great read, I am very intrigued about this author. I will have to read these finds. Thanks!!
item.content:encoded: This is a great read, I am very intrigued about this author. I will have to read these finds. Thanks!!

item.title: By: shinykicks (@shinykicks)
item.dc:creator: shinykicks (@shinykicks)
item.description:
Thanks for this superb article. I am going to have to dust off my Story of O this weekend (somewhere in the attic) and read it again.
Anne Desclos was a fascinating woman. She lived and wrote in very interesting times.
BTW Great blog - so happy to have found it.
shiny
item.content:encoded:
Thanks for this superb article. I am going to have to dust off my Story of O this weekend (somewhere in the attic) and read it again.

Anne Desclos was a fascinating woman. She lived and wrote in very interesting times.

BTW Great blog – so happy to have found it.

shiny
